events.message: The applicant submitted a request for a personal loan to cover medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The loan application was categorized under Personal Loan based on the mention of medical expenses and debt consolidation.
A loan officer was assigned to handle the personal loan case, ensuring personalized support throughout the process.
The initial review focused on verifying applicant information and assessing the loan purpose, which included debt repayment.
Documents related to medical bills, income proof, and existing debts were requested to better evaluate the loan application.
Applicant submitted all requested documents, including medical bills, bank statements, and debt summaries for review.
Credit check was completed, revealing an average credit score with some outstanding debt balances, typical for personal loans.
Risk assessment evaluated the applicant’s financial stability and medical expense impact, considering moderate risk factors.
A personal loan offer was presented to the applicant, outlining terms that accommodate debt repayment and medical bills.
Applicant provided positive feedback on loan terms, requesting minor adjustments to repayment scheduling for convenience.
The application was escalated for senior management review to consider revised repayment plan requested by applicant.
The personal loan was approved with adjusted repayment terms favorable to the applicant’s financial situation.
Loan funds were disbursed successfully, enabling the applicant to cover medical expenses and consolidate debt effectively.
Post-approval contact was made with the applicant to ensure satisfaction with the loan and answer any new questions.
The loan application process was successfully closed after confirming all funding and follow-up activities were complete.
